column4: dublue2, have you tried just typing the command without parameters to see if it is installed or not?
it says command not found and recommends for me to install ndiswrapper-common.  but it shows that it's installed in synaptic
it is happenning with other commands as well, for example, firefox?
no, other commands work fine
which distro are you using?
karmic 9.10... i think i figured it out... i may not have build-essential installed... checking that now
Ok, please let us know about it
it was isntalled, so i guess that wasn't it
i have the same error as the person in the first post here:  http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-156333.html
Have you tried Ubuntu Software Center?
it shows it as installed
why don't you uninstall and install again?
i have tried that, but will do it again.  let's see what happens
Ok, I wait here, thanks
shold i restart after installing before i reinstall?
I'm not quite sure but in Linux you don't supposed to, is not Win-does
reinstalling it worked
excellent, congratulations!
thanks for the help.  unfortunately that doesn't fix my problem of trying to install a mini pci dell 1390 wireless card
Did you look for it on the compatible list?
yes i will look into that, thank you.  i will reboot now.
no problem, hope it works for you.
